results.title: Ecological biology
results.creator_credit: Bruce J. Russell and Coronet Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Biological sciences”.
Shows that an ecosystem is a system of interactions between the physical environment and the varied species populations which inhabit it. Describes how the ecological relationships in any given environment follow basic principles. Indicates that our own human species must make informed decisions based on an awareness of these principles and highlights the consequences of ignoring them. Stresses that human activities must be adapted to maintain the delicate balance of a complex worldwide ecosystem.

results.title: Evolutionary biology
results.creator_credit: Bruce J. Russell, Biomedia Associates and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Biological sciences”.
This film presents the salient points of modern evolutionary theory, stressing the role of mutation and sexual reproduction in producing variation within populations. Also examines theories of natural selection and random mutation as explanations of environmental adaptation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bruce J. Russell, Biomedia Associates and Coronet Instructional Films

results.title: Developmental biology
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Biological sciences”.
Examines the orderly and inevitable life cycle of an organism from the moment of fertilization through embryology to maturation. This film also probes the role of genetic programming in this biological mystery. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Cell biology
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Biological sciences”.
Commencing with 3.5 billion year old fossil evidence, this program traces cellular development from prokaryotes, the cellular pioneers of our oxygen based ecology system, through to the eukaryotic cells, which compose all advanced forms of life. Introduces recent theory to explain the quantam leap forward in complexity from prokaryotes to eukaryotic cells. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Molecular biology
results.creator_credit: Bruce J. Russell and Coronet Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Biological sciences”.
An examination of the DNA based molecular control system. Investigates the primordial origins of DNA, the master molecule of life, and the structure of proteins, fats and carbohydrates. Also discusses current theories of how DNA is organised into chromosomes which store and transmit vast amounts of genetic information. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels

results.title: Genetic biology
results.creator_credit: Mel Waskin, Bruce J. Russell, Biomedia Associates and Coronet
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Biological sciences”.
Examines two qualities that are essential to the existence of species: the genetic mechanisms that preserve continuity from one generation to the next and the mechanisms that ensure variation. Also explores the recent breakthroughs of molecular genetics in the area of recombinant DNA which have led to biological applications with strong social implications.

results.title: The Water of life
results.creator_credit: Tom Williamson and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Big ice: views of Antarctica”.
The Antarctic continent is a unique natural laboratory for the study of simple life forms, and of physical and behavioural adaptations to inhospitable surroundings. The ocean surrounding Antarctica also has the world’s greatest untrapped food supply. The film asks whether controlled exploitation and development can take place without upsetting the delicate balance of nature.

results.title: Ice society
results.creator_credit: Tom Williamson and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Big ice: views of Antarctica”.
This series examines the great southern continent and man’s connection with it. This particular film, which is episode four, looks at the intriguing adaptations, both physical and behavioural, of plant and wildlife in the inhospitable surroundings of the Antarctic.

results.title: Out of sight, out of mind
results.creator_credit: Tom Williamson and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Big ice: views of Antarctica”.
Looks at the history of Antarctic exploration, incorporating still photographs and rare archival film. Includes footage of the expeditions of Scott, Amundsen and Shackleton and Admiral Byrd’s flight to the South Pole, with Sir Edmund Hillary’s tractor journey to the pole.
